info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 30 at 3:54AM CDT until June 30 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Hastings NE
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of north central Kansas, including the following counties, Jewell and Smith.
* WHEN...Until 1000 AM CDT Monday.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 350 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen in the last 2 hours, with another 1 to 2 inches possible before rain ends this morning. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the Advisory area. - This includes, but is not limited to, the following streams and drainages... Burr Oak Creek, Limestone Creek, White Rock Creek, Cora Creek and Oak Creek. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... Lebanon, Burr Oak, Esbon, Webber, Bellaire and Lovewell State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CDT THIS MORNING
